topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Block Storage Volume Operations (Cinder) Overview

body.p: The HPE Helion OpenStack Block Storage Volume Operations uses the OpenStack Cinder (Block Storage) service to manage storage volumes, including creating volumes, creating volume snapshots, and configuring volumes.
Once created, you can easily disconnect block storage volumes from one instance and attach them to another. You can also create snapshots of these volumes.

HPE Helion OpenStack uses StoreVirtual as a backend to Cinder to realize horizontally scalable block storage. StoreVirtual is unique in the sense that the storage controller runs as a virtual appliance and helps realize Software Defined Block Storage. To use StoreVirtual you must use the KVM hypervisor.
HPE Helion OpenStack also supports HPE StoreServ 3PAR as a Cinder backend.

section.title: Working with the Volume Operations Service
section.p: To perform tasks using the Volume Operations service, you can use the dashboard, API or CLI.

section.title: Using the dashboards
section.p: You can use the HPE Helion OpenStack Dashboard to work with the Volume Operations service.

section.title: Using the API
section.p: You can use a low-level, raw REST API for access to the HPE Volume Operations service. See the OpenStack Block Storage API v2.0 Reference.

section.title: Using the CLI
section.p: You can use any of several command-line interfaces to access HPE Volume Operations service. See OpenStack Command Line Interface Reference.
For more information on installing the CLI, see Install the OpenStack command-line clients.

section.title: For more information
section.p: For more general information on how to operate your cloud, refer to the OpenStack Operations Guide. The Architecture section contains useful information about how an OpenStack Cloud is put together. However, the HPE Helion OpenStack takes care of these details for you. The Operations section contains information on how to manage the system.
